trans-unit.source: Machine Learning Gallery of experiments | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Machine Learning Gallery of experiments | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Share and discover machine learning experiments in the Azure Machine Learning Gallery.
trans-unit.target: Share and discover machine learning experiments in the Azure Machine Learning Gallery.

trans-unit.source: Learn from others’ experiments, or just get started with machine learning.
trans-unit.target: Learn from others’ experiments, or just get started with machine learning.

trans-unit.source: Share and discover machine learning experiments in Machine Learning Gallery
trans-unit.target: Share and discover machine learning experiments in Machine Learning Gallery

trans-unit.source: The Azure Machine Learning Gallery is a community driven site for discovering experiments that solve interesting problems.
trans-unit.target: The Azure Machine Learning Gallery is a community driven site for discovering experiments that solve interesting problems.

trans-unit.source: It is a destination for users looking to learn from others’ experiments, or to simply get started on Azure Machine Learning.
trans-unit.target: It is a destination for users looking to learn from others’ experiments, or to simply get started on Azure Machine Learning.

trans-unit.source: These experiments are primarily contributed by the Azure Machine Learning user community.
trans-unit.target: These experiments are primarily contributed by the Azure Machine Learning user community.

trans-unit.source: The Gallery also enables users to browse and copy experiments contributed by Microsoft Azure Machine Learning Team.
trans-unit.target: The Gallery also enables users to browse and copy experiments contributed by Microsoft Azure Machine Learning Team.

trans-unit.source: TAKE ME TO THE GALLERY >>
trans-unit.target: TAKE ME TO THE GALLERY >>

trans-unit.source: Benefits
trans-unit.target: Benefits

trans-unit.source: Start using the Gallery to enjoy these benefits:
trans-unit.target: Start using the Gallery to enjoy these benefits:

trans-unit.source: Discover interesting experiments
trans-unit.target: Discover interesting experiments

trans-unit.source: Learn from others
trans-unit.target: Learn from others

trans-unit.source: Sign in using your Microsoft account to enjoy this additional benefits:
trans-unit.target: Sign in using your Microsoft account to enjoy this additional benefits:

trans-unit.source: Copy experiments to your workspace and get started with solving your own problems using Azure ML
trans-unit.target: Copy experiments to your workspace and get started with solving your own problems using Azure ML

trans-unit.source: Contribute and showcase your work
trans-unit.target: Contribute and showcase your work

trans-unit.source: Discover
trans-unit.target: Discover

trans-unit.source: You can search and browse interesting experiments in the Gallery that help solve your machine learning needs or to simply get started on creating Azure Machine Learning experiments.
trans-unit.target: You can search and browse interesting experiments in the Gallery that help solve your machine learning needs or to simply get started on creating Azure Machine Learning experiments.

trans-unit.source: You can start using gallery for discovering and learning more about experiments without signing in.
trans-unit.target: You can start using gallery for discovering and learning more about experiments without signing in.

trans-unit.source: Easily find recently published experiments, trending experiments in the gallery or search by experiment name, tags, algorithms and other attributes.
trans-unit.target: Easily find recently published experiments, trending experiments in the gallery or search by experiment name, tags, algorithms and other attributes.

trans-unit.source: View experiment contributions from a particular author by clicking on the author name from within any of the experiment tiles.
trans-unit.target: View experiment contributions from a particular author by clicking on the author name from within any of the experiment tiles.

trans-unit.source: If interested in a particular experiment, you can read additional information about the experiment in the experiment Details Page.
trans-unit.target: If interested in a particular experiment, you can read additional information about the experiment in the experiment Details Page.

trans-unit.source: You can also comment, provide feedback or ask questions through the comments section on each experiment page.
trans-unit.target: You can also comment, provide feedback or ask questions through the comments section on each experiment page.

trans-unit.source: You can further share an experiment of interest with friends or colleagues using share capabilities with LinkedIn or Twitter accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can further share an experiment of interest with friends or colleagues using share capabilities with LinkedIn or Twitter accounts.

trans-unit.source: You may also email links to these experiments to invite other users to view the experiment pages.
trans-unit.target: You may also email links to these experiments to invite other users to view the experiment pages.

trans-unit.source: Download
trans-unit.target: Download

trans-unit.source: Azure Machine Learning Gallery you to easily copy experiments to your workspace with a single click and immediately start using it for your purpose.
trans-unit.target: Azure Machine Learning Gallery you to easily copy experiments to your workspace with a single click and immediately start using it for your purpose.

trans-unit.source: If you are not already signed in while browsing, you will be prompted to sign-in using your Microsoft account before the experiment is copied to their studio workspace.
trans-unit.target: If you are not already signed in while browsing, you will be prompted to sign-in using your Microsoft account before the experiment is copied to their studio workspace.

trans-unit.source: Contribute
trans-unit.target: Contribute

trans-unit.source: Are you ready to start contributing experiments to the Gallery?
trans-unit.target: Are you ready to start contributing experiments to the Gallery?

trans-unit.source: Follow these steps:
trans-unit.target: Follow these steps:

trans-unit.source: Sign-in to the studio using your Microsoft account (Please make sure your profile picture and Name in the Microsoft Account profile settings are as you want them showing up)
trans-unit.target: Sign-in to the studio using your Microsoft account (Please make sure your profile picture and Name in the Microsoft Account profile settings are as you want them showing up)

trans-unit.source: Create your experiment and run it
trans-unit.target: Create your experiment and run it

trans-unit.source: When you’re ready to publish your experiment to the Gallery, click on ‘Publish to Gallery’ in the Studio’s lower black bar.
trans-unit.target: When you’re ready to publish your experiment to the Gallery, click on ‘Publish to Gallery’ in the Studio’s lower black bar.

trans-unit.source: Publish
trans-unit.target: Publish

trans-unit.source: Enjoy!
trans-unit.target: Enjoy!

trans-unit.source: We want to hear from you!
trans-unit.target: We want to hear from you!

trans-unit.source: We want the Gallery to be driven by our users and for our users.
trans-unit.target: We want the Gallery to be driven by our users and for our users.

trans-unit.source: Use the smiley on the right to tell us what you love or hate about the Gallery.
trans-unit.target: Use the smiley on the right to tell us what you love or hate about the Gallery.

trans-unit.source: Feedback
trans-unit.target: Feedback

trans-unit.source: Frequently Asked Questions
trans-unit.target: Frequently Asked Questions

trans-unit.source: I would like to make changes to the workflow of the experiment I submitted to the Gallery.
trans-unit.target: I would like to make changes to the workflow of the experiment I submitted to the Gallery.

trans-unit.source: How can I do that?
trans-unit.target: How can I do that?

trans-unit.source: As of right now we do not support workflow updates to experiments you have already published to the Gallery.
trans-unit.target: As of right now we do not support workflow updates to experiments you have already published to the Gallery.

trans-unit.source: You may publish any such changes as a new experiment into the Gallery and delete your old one.
trans-unit.target: You may publish any such changes as a new experiment into the Gallery and delete your old one.

trans-unit.source: We are actively working on enabling publising updates to workflow for already contributed Gallery.
trans-unit.target: We are actively working on enabling publising updates to workflow for already contributed Gallery.

trans-unit.source: Stay Tuned.
trans-unit.target: Stay Tuned.

trans-unit.source: **Will I need to publish a new experiment even if I have to edit only the tags or description?**
trans-unit.target: **Will I need to publish a new experiment even if I have to edit only the tags or description?**

trans-unit.source: Following type of edits can be made to an experiment you have already contributed, without having to go through a publish again:
trans-unit.target: Following type of edits can be made to an experiment you have already contributed, without having to go through a publish again:

trans-unit.source: Experiment Name
trans-unit.target: Experiment Name

trans-unit.source: Summary Text
trans-unit.target: Summary Text

trans-unit.source: Description Text
trans-unit.target: Description Text

trans-unit.source: Tags
trans-unit.target: Tags

trans-unit.source: Images
trans-unit.target: Images

trans-unit.source: In order to edit these fields, click on the specific experiment you would like to edit(make sure you're signed in with your Microsoft account).
trans-unit.target: In order to edit these fields, click on the specific experiment you would like to edit(make sure you're signed in with your Microsoft account).

trans-unit.source: This will navigate you to the experiment details page where you can see options to edit or delete.
trans-unit.target: This will navigate you to the experiment details page where you can see options to edit or delete.

trans-unit.source: Clicking on 'Edit' allows you to edit any of the above fields.
trans-unit.target: Clicking on 'Edit' allows you to edit any of the above fields.

trans-unit.source: I just published my experiment to the Azure Machine Learning Gallery.
trans-unit.target: I just published my experiment to the Azure Machine Learning Gallery.

trans-unit.source: I don’t see my profile picture showing up with my name
trans-unit.target: I don’t see my profile picture showing up with my name

trans-unit.source: It is possible that you are using an account other than @outlook, @msn, @live or @hotmail.
trans-unit.target: It is possible that you are using an account other than @outlook, @msn, @live or @hotmail.

trans-unit.source: If that is the case, you will see a placeholder image instead of the profile picture from your Microsoft account configuration settings.
trans-unit.target: If that is the case, you will see a placeholder image instead of the profile picture from your Microsoft account configuration settings.

trans-unit.source: Using a Microsoft account and re-submitting the experiment should help solve this issue
trans-unit.target: Using a Microsoft account and re-submitting the experiment should help solve this issue

trans-unit.source: I updated my profile picture in my Microsoft account configuration settings.
trans-unit.target: I updated my profile picture in my Microsoft account configuration settings.

trans-unit.source: Why are my existing experiment contributions not reflecting this new profile picture?
trans-unit.target: Why are my existing experiment contributions not reflecting this new profile picture?

trans-unit.source: If you are looking to reflect the most recent profile change (profile picture or first name or last name) for all your experiments, you should re-submit the older experiments to the Gallery.
trans-unit.target: If you are looking to reflect the most recent profile change (profile picture or first name or last name) for all your experiments, you should re-submit the older experiments to the Gallery.

trans-unit.source: In doing so you will need to delete the older copies that reflect the old profile settings.
trans-unit.target: In doing so you will need to delete the older copies that reflect the old profile settings.

trans-unit.source: What are the image requirements when submitting or editing an image for my experiment?
trans-unit.target: What are the image requirements when submitting or editing an image for my experiment?

trans-unit.source: The images you submit along with your experiment will be used to create an experiment tile for your contribution.
trans-unit.target: The images you submit along with your experiment will be used to create an experiment tile for your contribution.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that the images be < 500Kb in size, with an aspect ratio of 3:2.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended that the images be < 500Kb in size, with an aspect ratio of 3:2.

trans-unit.source: A resolution of 960x640 is recommended
trans-unit.target: A resolution of 960x640 is recommended

trans-unit.source: What happens to the dataset I have used in the experiment?
trans-unit.target: What happens to the dataset I have used in the experiment?

trans-unit.source: Does the data set get published to the Gallery as well?
trans-unit.target: Does the data set get published to the Gallery as well?

trans-unit.source: If your Data Set is part of your experiment and not being pulled through a reader module, it is part of your experiment and gets published to the Gallery with your experiment.
trans-unit.target: If your Data Set is part of your experiment and not being pulled through a reader module, it is part of your experiment and gets published to the Gallery with your experiment.

trans-unit.source: For this reason ensure that the data set you are publishing with the experiment has the appropriate licensing terms that allowed sharing and downloading by anybody.
trans-unit.target: For this reason ensure that the data set you are publishing with the experiment has the appropriate licensing terms that allowed sharing and downloading by anybody.

trans-unit.source: I have an experiment that uses a Reader module to pull data from HDInsight or SQL.
trans-unit.target: I have an experiment that uses a Reader module to pull data from HDInsight or SQL.

trans-unit.source: It uses my credentials to retrieve the data.
trans-unit.target: It uses my credentials to retrieve the data.

trans-unit.source: How can I publish such an experiment and be assured that my credentials will not be shared?
trans-unit.target: How can I publish such an experiment and be assured that my credentials will not be shared?

trans-unit.source: At this time we do not allow publishing of experiments that use credentials.
trans-unit.target: At this time we do not allow publishing of experiments that use credentials.

trans-unit.source: How do I de-limit tags?
trans-unit.target: How do I de-limit tags?

trans-unit.source: You can use tab to de-limit tags.
trans-unit.target: You can use tab to de-limit tags.

trans-unit.source: I see some experiments have rich descriptions with rich rendering capabilities.
trans-unit.target: I see some experiments have rich descriptions with rich rendering capabilities.

trans-unit.source: However when I try to provide a description, the description is presented in plain text.
trans-unit.target: However when I try to provide a description, the description is presented in plain text.

trans-unit.source: Rich description rendering is not available to all Gallery users widely.
trans-unit.target: Rich description rendering is not available to all Gallery users widely.

trans-unit.source: We are actively working on making this capability available through support for markdown rendering.
trans-unit.target: We are actively working on making this capability available through support for markdown rendering.

trans-unit.source: TAKE ME TO THE GALLERY >>
trans-unit.target: TAKE ME TO THE GALLERY >>

trans-unit.source: test
trans-unit.target: test
